definition: to play the role of the hero (idiom)/to play the good cop
(bird species of China) red-faced cormorant (Phalacrocorax urile)

sentences.english: Is this not of more consequence than a fat red-faced gentleman's sums?
sentences.chinese: 這難道不比那個大胖子紅臉先生的帳目更重要？

sentences.english: I hate it when guys play weak and let the woman be the tough one.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭男孩子裝軟弱裝無能，而讓女孩子唱紅臉。

sentences.english: A portly, rubicund man of middle age"."
The red-faced, merry soldier was still twitching convulsively ; but they did not carry him away.
sentences.chinese: 那個紅臉的士兵還在抽搐，但沒有人來擡他。

sentences.english: She often blushes when speaking to strangers.
He had a red face, grey eyes and a long black beard.
sentences.chinese: 他有一張紅臉，灰色的眼睛和長長的黑鬍子。

sentences.english: For instance, red for heroism, white for villainy .
sentences.chinese: 好比，紅臉表英雄，白臉表反派。

sentences.english: If that didn’t work there was the ‘cummerbund’ to hide a paunch and - if you couldn’t even make it up the stairs without turning ‘crimson’ –they had the ‘bungalow’.
sentences.chinese: 如果你上臺階會紅臉，他們有平房。

sentences.english: And reddening Phoebus lifts his golden fire.
sentences.chinese: 徒有紅臉的菲勃斯高舉金色的火。

definition: to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
erhua variant of 一股腦|一股脑[yi1 gu3 nao3]
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
